channel.title: What program do you use to edit java files?
channel.description:
I thought it might add some variety to the Java Programming board :)
I use a program called BlueJ, its pretty good, but it can be slow at times (probably because it's written in Java).

item.title: What program do you use to edit java files?
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

[quote=“happy_world_020, post:37, topic:23689”]Do somebody now how to get IntelliJ IDEA 6.0.2 with no charge[/quote]moparisthebest uploaded his key, just look where it sounds most obvious. Hint: not on the forums.

item.title: What program do you use to edit java files?
item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

Have a look in the 3rd party programs section. I believe there’s a serial key in there.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Edit: I was just trying to decide between IntelliJ IDEA, NetBeans or Eclipse, and the two main things I were looking for were GUI builders and low memory usage. I just thought I’d post the recommended/minimum system requirements for IntelliJ IDEA and NetBeans (I couldn’t find the Eclipse requirements, however I do know that it lags like hell on my computer).

IntelliJ IDEA:

System requirements for IntelliJ IDEA: 
* Minimum: CPU - PII 500 (Mac: 733 MHz G4); RAM - 192 Mb (Mac: 256 Mb); HDD 200 Mb
* Recommended: CPU - PIII 800+ (Mac: 1.42 GHz G4), RAM - 256+ Mb, HDD 400 Mb</blockquote>

NetBeans:

Minimum Hardware Configurations

Note: The IDE’s minimum screen resolution is 1024x768 pixels.

* Microsoft Windows operating systems:
      o Processor: 500 MHz Intel Pentium III workstation or equivalent
      o Memory: 512 MB
      o Disk space: 850 MB of free disk space

* Linux operating system:
      o Processor: 500 MHz Intel Pentium III workstation or equivalent
      o Memory: 512 MB
      o Disk space: 450 MB of free disk space

Recommended Hardware Configurations

* Microsoft Windows operating systems:
      o Processor: 1.4 GHz Intel Pentium III workstation or equivalent
      o Memory: 1 GB
      o Disk space: 1 GB of free disk space

* Linux operating system:
      o Processor: 1.4 GHz Intel Pentium III or equivalent
      o Memory: 1 GB
      o Disk space: 850 MB of free disk space</blockquote>It seems that NetBeans is much more of a mem whore, however the IntelliJ IDEA article seems to be 3 years out of date.

Read full topic

item.title: What program do you use to edit java files?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

There isn’t really a ‘best.’ Usually javac is fine for a compiler. For an editor I use either eclipse or good old JCreator (Nice and fast, no unnescessary features).

Read full topic
